trans-unit.source: Contains information about the canonicalization algorithm and signature algorithm used for the XML signature.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> class represents the <`SignedInfo`> element of an XML signature defined by the XML digital signature specification.

The <`SignedInfo`> element, which is a subelement of the <`Signature`> element, contains the canonicalization method used for signing, the algorithm used for signing and validation, and references that describe a digital signature.

For most scenarios, you should use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> class available from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.SignedInfo%2A> property to sign and verify XML digital signatures.
For more information about the <`SignedInfo`> element, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference"></xref> object to the list of references to digest and sign.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.AddReference%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> object to a collection that is accessible using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.References%2A> property.
The reference to add to the list of references.
The reference parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets the canonicalization algorithm that is used before signing for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethod%2A> property uses a string Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to represent the <`Canonicalization`> element of an XML digital signature.

Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethod%2A> property to specify the canonicalization algorithm applied to the XML output of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> class before performing signature calculations.
Use one of the URIs listed in the following table with this property.
Canonicalization Method
Value
Canonical XML
http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315
This is default method.
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigCanonicalizationUrl>
Canonical XML with comments
http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315#WithComments
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigCanonicalizationWithCommentsUrl>
Exclusive Canonical XML
http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransformUrl>
Exclusive Canonical XML with comments
http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#WithComments
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigExcC14NWithCommentsTransformUrl>
For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
The canonicalization algorithm used before signing for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Gets a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object used for canonicalization.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethodObject%2A> property contains the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object used by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> class to canonicalize an XML document before signing or verifying.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethodObject%2A> property is read-only.

You can modify the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object within this property by passing the desired transform Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethod%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object used for canonicalization.
<xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> is `null`.
Copies the elements of this instance into an <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object, starting at a specified index in the array.
An <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object that holds the collection's elements.
The beginning index in the array where the elements are copied.
This method is not supported.
Gets the number of references in the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
The number of references in the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
This property is not supported.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection of references.
An enumerator that iterates through the collection of references.
This method is not supported.
Returns the XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
The XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.SignatureMethod"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.References"></xref> property is empty.
Gets or sets the ID of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.Id%2A> property to add a string ID to the XML representation of the current <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> element.
The ID is used to reference the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> from another location.
The ID of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not supported.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is synchronized.
`true` if the collection is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not supported.
Loads a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> state from an XML element.
The XML element from which to load the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> state.
The value parameter is `null`.
The value parameter is not a valid element.
-or-
The value parameter does not contain a valid property.
-or-
The value parameter does not contain a valid property.
Gets a list of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference"></xref> objects of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.References%2A> property uses a list of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> objects to represent the `<Reference>` elements of an XML digital signature.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.References%2A> property to describe the transforms, digest algorithms, and digest values of an XML digital signature.
For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
A list of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference"></xref> elements of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the length of the signature for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
The length of the signature for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the name of the algorithm used for signature generation and validation for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.SignatureMethod%2A> property uses a string Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to represents the `<SignatureMethod>` element of an XML digital signature.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.SignatureMethod%2A> property to specify the algorithm to use for signature generation and verification.
This property identifies all cryptographic functions involved in creating an XML digital signature, including hashing, public key algorithms, Message Authentication Codes (MACs), and padding.
Use one of the URIs in the following table with this property.
Signature Method
Value
HMAC-SHA1
http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#hmac-sha1
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigHMACSHA1Url>
DSA with SHA1
http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#dsa-sha1
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigDSAUrl>
RSA with SHA1
http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1
Also defined in the following static field: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigRSASHA1Url>
For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/).
The name of the algorithm used for signature generation and validation for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo"></xref> object.
Gets an object to use for synchronization.
An object to use for synchronization.
This property is not supported.
